hell.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the place where the souls of bad people are believed to be punished after death, especially in the Christian and Muslim religions
hell.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a place or situation in which people suffer very much, either physically or emotionally
hell.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: My mother made my life hell.
These past few days have been a living hell.
She must have gone through hell every day, the way we teased her about her weight.
He says his time in jail was hell on earth.
They described the war zone as sheer hell.
hell.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a situation, experience, or place that is very unpleasant
hell.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The traffic was hell this morning.
hell.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to express anger or annoyance
hell.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Oh hell! I’ve left my purse at home.
